comment.author: 36899742@N00
comment._content: Probably the French golfer Louis Tellier, who came to America in 1913 to play in a tournament and stayed on as a club pro until his death by suicide in 1921. Here is the report of his death in the New York Times: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9902E1DF1539E1...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Date written on negative is 9/17/13, which will have been the second day of the USGA National Open Tournament was played at Brookline, Mass. See NYT of Sept 17 implying play began the day before. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F02EFDA163DE633A...
